features: UPRIGHT & EXPANDABLE - Accordion File Organizer, 12 pockets, multi-colored tabs, Open top, for letter/A4 size
LARGE CAPACITY & SPACE SAVER - 12 pockets, full size expansion top & bottom, expand and shrink with growing files flexibly, as small or large as a want it
EASY ACCESS - No cover and no hamper, open top and colorful Tabs, coding files in month order
FREE-STANDING - Polypropylene (PP) material, more thicker, sturdy and durable. Perfectly standing in your drawer, closet, cabinet or desktop
Tips: To keep the file organizer balanced and standing, Please don't store bulky files on just one side. (Not suit to move filled folder from place to place frequently）

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I got this to organize my greeting cards. I often check out the car aisle & buy a bunch of cards at a time. I've got dozens on them & currently keep them in a couple of shoe boxes. It's gotten tiresome sorting through them all to find the perfect card for my needs.I'd bought a ard sorter with dividers but it isn't large enough to hold all of the cards I have. Also, it's designed for standard sized cards. I have some that are large & oddly shaped, so they don't fit. I'm determined to have all of my cars in one place.This accordion file organizer can expand to accept more cards & shrink back when there are fewer cards. It is able to hold all of my cards. I appreciate that the manufacturers included labels that are blank so I can label the dividers according to my needs.I wish that this had a lid. I know that would be difficult with a file that expands & contracts but I'll bet some creative person could come up with a design. I'll try to find something that will fit since this will be sitting on a shelf long-term & I don't want the cards to collect dust. If I were using it as a file, I don't think I'd want that to collect dust either. Since files also tend to hold things long-term, one wouldn't want those items to get dusty either. Maybe the manufacturers could come up with a solution for covering the file. Anyway, I really love it & would definitely recommend it to others.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does the job for keeping my receipts organized
reviews.reviewText: Arrives wrapped in plastic with a Made in China barcode sticker407g (14.36oz)Black with 12 tabs on the inside in 6 different colors - this technically gives you 13 pockets to store things, but one pocket does not have a tab to label itThe organizer is 13" wide x 9.5" tall. It is 1/2 inch thick when empty but expands to 12" to hold papers. There is a black elastic band that you can use to hold everything together but I found it difficult to get around the accordion when it was empty, and it also limits how many papers you can put in the accordion to maybe 3 inches. I won't be using that for long before I need more than 3" of storageIt also has a pocket on the front which comes with card paper so you can label what you are storing insideIt comes with 27 stickers which you can write on and attach to the tabs to help you keep organized - 12 of them are pre-printed with month abbreviations, the others you can easily write on what ever you wantA dozen is a few tabs short for what I needed, but I was able to put file folders in some of the tabs to increase my number of categories I have available to classify expenses. One thing I found cool about this accordion organizer is that the separating tabs are attached not only at the sides, but also to the bottom, so you have a true pocket - my receipts won't be slipping out of their category and into another one. For that this gets a 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Useful expandable filing!!
reviews.reviewText: This plastic file organizer is accordion style so you can fit a lot of papers inside it or just a few and it can expand or collapse depending how full it is. Even with a lot of papers inside, it compacts down to a slim profile, and I love the rainbow color file separators. It comes with month labels for the tabs. It also has an elastic band on the back that you can wrap around the front in order to keep it collapsed, but it will generally stay extended or collapsed with or without the band. The front also has a pocket you can put a label in. Definitely a great addition to any office. It is designed for US letter size paper but can still hold 12"x12" scrapbook paper, too, though it's taller than the tabs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Ideal for filing receipts
reviews.reviewText: This file organizer is made of plastic and designed for stationary medium-duty use. If you file papers to its fullest extent the elastic band will not work. The band will work when the file organizer is empty or nearly empty. It is not designed to move files around. There are other organizers on Amazon that have a cover flap and are cheaper. It is price competitive with organizers without a cover flap. My wife uses this organizer for file receipts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is works great!
reviews.reviewText: I was torn…this accordion file is fantastic and fits quite a bit in it but I didn’t know if I should keep it for my home office or my work office. But home won out. It is so well organized and fits so much in it that I decided that it was better suited at home since I didn’t have as many drawers for filing like I do at the office.This is very sturdy and durable and looks great sitting out on the desk or office shelf.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fine for Home Use
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a file organizer to file letter size documents Wanted to file guarantees, instruction books, notices, etc. This file organizer is fine for my home use. It is made of "Polypropylene" which I would call plastic. While good for home use, I would not use it for business use in my formal office (Yes, I am a high quality snob).Each of the 12 pockets will hold about 1/2 inch of letter size papers (normal 20 to 24 lb stock). The unit does stand upright and his an elastic band which can wrap around the entire unit to collapse it when empty or holding a few papers. It is has very colorful tabs and a black outside (which I really like). Adhesive "stick on" tabs preprinted with Jan- to Dec and 27 blank stickers are multicolored. I will use my label machine to produce tabs.i would characterize the organizer as medium-high quality which would be useful and suitable for most who need a file organizer. The organizer is as described.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love that this accordion expands to work almost like a filing cabinet. I save my husband’s work expense receipts all year and this folder helps me to easily file them. Once I’m done with the folder I’m able to tightly close it back together and file in a small space on my shelf instead of taking up a bunch of room. It’s very handy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Open top. Holds a lot when expanded
reviews.reviewText: It holds a lot, but there is no flap going across the top to close it. The elastic wraps around the middle but not across the top, so taking it with you in a bag could be an issue. And the elastic is pretty tight, so I don't think you could have it all the way full and put the elastic around it.
